availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry C. Ellis (Henry County, Kentucky, retired merchant)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, retired merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Catherine J. Prier Ellis in Shelby County on November 10, 1839. Married to Margaret Jane Armstrong Ellis in Shelby County on October 23, 1849. Married to Edna Daugherty Ellis in Shelby County on August 31, 1853. Married to Bettie Ellis. Father of Charles W. Ellis. Retired merchant in Henry County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Henry County in 1860. Member of the Masonic Order in Eminence Lodge, No. 282 at Eminence, Kentucky.
